page.title:
ZOMETA® Overview
ZOMETA® Z O M E T A ®
Overview
page.enlisting:
▪ ZOMETA belongs to a new class of highly potent ▪ Treatment of hypercalcemia of malignancy – Approved by FDA in August 2001 – Approved in over 60 countries ▪ Treatment of bone metastases – Filed July 2001 in EU and August 2001 in US and – Dose: Zoledronic acid 4 mg infused over 15 min ▪ Non-oncologic uses under evaluation – Paget’s disease, osteoporosis, rheumatoid arthritis ▪ ZOMETA belongs to a new class of highly potent

page.title:
IN-4
IN-4
page.normal_text:
ZOMETA® in Bone Metastases Proposed Indication
ZOMETA® in Bone Metastases Z O M E T A ® i n
B o n e
M e t a s t a s e s
Proposed Indication

ZOMETA (zoledronic acid) is indicated for the treatment of osteolytic, osteoblastic, and mixed bone metastases of solid tumors and osteolytic lesions of multiple myeloma, in conjunction with standard antineoplastic therapy
ZOMETA (zoledronic acid) is
indicated for the treatment of
osteolytic, osteoblastic, and mixed
bone metastases of solid tumors
and osteolytic lesions of multiple
myeloma, in conjunction with
standard antineoplastic therapy

page.title:
ZOMETA® in Bone Metastases Clinical Profile (1)
ZOMETA® in Bone Metastases Z O M E T A ® i n
B o n e
M e t a s t a s e s
Clinical Profile (1)
page.enlisting:
▪ ZOMETA is bone specific, not tumor specific; effective in a broad variety of tumor types studied – Breast cancer and multiple myeloma – Prostate and other solid tumors • Other bisphosphonates have not ▪ ZOMETA is bone specific, not tumor specific; effective in a broad variety of tumor types studied

page.normal_text:
ZOMETA® in Bone Metastases Clinical Profile (2)
ZOMETA® in Bone Metastases Z O M E T A ® i n
B o n e
M e t a s t a s e s
Clinical Profile (2)
page.enlisting:
▪ First bisphosphonate shown to be effective across a wide variety of solid tumor types in treatment of bone metastases ▪ Safety is comparable with that of i.v. pamidronate – Overall safety profile is supported by data ▪ First bisphosphonate shown to be effective across a wide variety of solid tumor types in treatment of bone metastases
